intro: Lippia contermina, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrublands and open woodlands. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies. Lippia contermina is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrance.
